name: Martinique on Macrossan

reviews.text: This place is OK off season for the Web rate. I wouldn’t want to pay the rack rate. Or be there if it were full. Insulation is non existent and noises from the other apartments were a problem. On our 2nd night we decided to have a quiet night in with take-out and a movie (2 movie channels) However the people in next apartment were entertaining friends and we were forced to put the volume on full to hear. They were sitting on their balcony,but they may as well have been in the room with us.
reviews.title: 4 Star in Queensland may not be what you expect

reviews.text: Kitchenette has microwave, toaster, cooking utensils & a lot of instructions taped to the wall. The fridge is too small; put in breakfast stuff; couple of beers &wine and it was full. Ants are a BIG problem in FNQ; they will attack any foodstuff not in fridge.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Martinique!

reviews.text: The lounge area was a decent size except we had most of our stuff draped on the chairs. There is one small wardrobe in the bedroom and nowhere to put bags except the floor. It is not serviced, but you can change your bath towels every 2nd day at the office if you can get there before closing time(6.00pm). There is an iron and board which I would gladly have swapped for a vacuum cleaner. They charge $5.00 pw for a hairdryer too.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.text: The public areas were extremely well kept, clean and appealing. The pool is household size and the pic.of the 4 lounges are it-there are 4.The one time we decided to hang out there, the racket from an overlooking apartment drove us away.
reviews.title: Great place, friendly hosts!
wow its hot
reviews.text: It’s close to Four mile beach which is fine for walking or running at low tide, too windy to spend much time on.
My wife and I switched to this apartment complex after we were disappointed with another apartment complex nearby and were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great apartment complex!

reviews.text: For the price and location, this is an excellent option! We were in walking distance to the 4 mile beach and all the shops/resturaunts in PD. The rooms were very nice, clean, spacious and up to date. Compared to the previous place we were staying, this place is a hidden treasure!
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again if we visit PD. Just an fyi, we were also debating between The Radisson Treetops hotel, but decided on the Martinque instead. Why pay $200 a night when you can get the same thing for only $95?
reviews.title: Very dark apartments

reviews.text: Found Martinique on Macrossan a very good place to stay and have given other people the phone number.
reviews.title: A great secret in Port Douglas
rooms good but noisy
reviews.text: My wife and mydelf stayed there on our honey moon and very much recommend it.

aka: Martinique On Macrossan Hotel Port Douglas
description: Martinique - perfect for a romantic getaway in the heart of Port Douglas; yet quiet, relaxing and charismatic. Martinique on Macrossan boasts 19 one bedroom apartments, each with their own kitchenette, bathroom and private balcony. Offering accommodation from one night to ninety one nights, this French Caribbean style complex is perfect for those wanting to escape the masses, stroll the beach just metres away, enjoy a BBQ in the lovingly maintained courtyard, or simply want to relax by the delightful pool area. This resort is one of a kind in Port Douglas, quiet, centrally located, charming, accepts one night stays and is child free. If you want to enjoy the tranquility and relaxing nature of this village, you must stay at Martinique.
